BBNJ References

Top 15 High-Quality Analyses of the BBNJ Agreement

  1. IISD Earth Negotiations Bulletin (ENB) ‚Äì Adoption & Key Provisions Overview (June 2023) ‚Äì authoritative wrap with negotiating history, article-by-article highlights, and politics of the deal. Link [1]

  2. IISD/ENB Running Dossier Page ‚Äì consolidates ENB coverage and context across sessions; useful for cross-checking provisions and process milestones. Link [2]

  3. Pew Charitable Trusts ‚Äì ‚ÄúInside the New High Seas Treaty‚Äù ‚Äì concise breakdown of treaty operation (MPAs/ABMTs, EIAs, MGRs, capacity-building). Brief | PDF [3]

  4. IUCN ‚Äì High Seas Biodiversity Treaty Policy Brief (2023‚Äì24) ‚Äì NGO-technical lens on implementation and UNCLOS interplay. Link [4]

  6. IDDRI Policy Brief ‚Äì ‚ÄúInitial reflections to support rapid, effective and equitable implementation‚Äù ‚Äì entry-into-force, institutions, finance, capacity, science. Link [6]

  7. Australian Parliament ‚Äì National Interest Analysis (NIA) for Ratification ‚Äì detailed legal analysis, including Art. 14 MGR benefit-sharing and DSI. PDF [7]

  8. Australian Parliament JSCOT Report ‚Äì Chapter 2 (BBNJ Agreement) ‚Äì parliamentary scrutiny of obligations, costs/benefits, and domestic compatibility. Report [8]

  9. UNEP Explainer (2025) ‚Äì UN system synthesis on purpose, scope, and strengthening of the global legal framework. Link [9]

  10. US Congressional Research Service (CRS) In Focus (Dec 2024) ‚Äì provisions and US ratification posture; balanced and concise. PDF [10]

  11. EJIL:Talk! ‚Äì Dispute Settlement under BBNJ ‚Äì doctrinal analysis of compulsory dispute settlement choices and jurisdiction. Link [11]

  12. EJIL:Talk! ‚Äì ITLOS Advisory Jurisdiction under BBNJ ‚Äì treaty‚Äôs innovation on ITLOS advisory opinions via COP request. Link [12]

  13. EJIL:Talk! ‚Äì BBNJ‚ÄìISA Interface (Seabed Mining & ABMTs) ‚Äì coherence/‚Äúno-undermining‚Äù vis-√†-vis the ISA and REMPs. Link [13]

  14. Marine Policy ‚Äì Interaction of the BBNJ Agreement and the Legal Regime of the Area ‚Äì peer-reviewed analysis of institutional interplay. DOI [14]
